sn4.14:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Kosalans near the brahmin village of Ekasālā.
sn4.14:1.2: Now, at that time the Buddha was teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.
sn4.14:2.2: “The ascetic Gotama is teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.
sn4.14:2.3: Why don’t I go and pull the wool over their eyes?”
sn4.14:2.4: Then Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha and addressed him in verse:
sn4.14:3.4: don’t get caught up in favoring and opposing.”
sn4.14:4.2: out of compassion for their welfare.
sn4.14:5.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
